meanings.definition: The quality of lasting or continuing for a long time.
meanings.sent1: Her enduringness in the face of challenges inspired everyone around her.
meanings.sent2: The enduringness of the ancient ruins amazed the archaeologists.
meanings.sent3: Despite the rain, the enduringness of the tent kept the campers dry.
meanings.sent4: The enduringness of their friendship was like a sturdy oak tree in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The enduringness of the mountain stood as a testament to time itself.

meanings.definition: The ability to withstand wear, pressure, or damage.
meanings.sent1: The enduringness of the metal made it perfect for building bridges.
meanings.sent2: The enduringness of the fabric ensured the jacket would last for years.
meanings.sent3: The enduringness of the rubber tire saved the car from a flat.
meanings.sent4: The enduringness of the shield protected the knight in battle.
meanings.sent5: The enduringness of the diamond made it a symbol of eternity.

meanings.definition: The state of being persistent or steadfast.
meanings.sent1: His enduringness in pursuing his dreams never wavered.
meanings.sent2: The enduringness of her belief in justice fueled her activism.
meanings.sent3: The enduringness of the detective's search finally paid off.
meanings.sent4: The enduringness of the marathon runner's spirit carried him to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The enduringness of the teacher's patience helped her students succeed.
